summary: Sound insulation refers to the measures and materials used in building and public works to mitigate the transmission of sound between spaces. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, sound insulation is crucial for ensuring compliance with health and safety standards, as well as enhancing the quality of life in residential and commercial environments. The EU promotes guidelines and directives that mandate specific sound insulation requirements for new constructions and renovations, aiming to protect citizens from noise pollution. Effective sound insulation contributes to sustainable urban development and aligns with the EU's objectives of fostering well-being and environmental quality in built environments.
